node.title: DAY SIX
node.excerpt:
Dissatisfactions, directions and delight. Last night the trio decided Italian food was the order of the day and were recommended the Tricolour in Ramsgate. Off they set on foot, sadly no tables were available being a popular place on a Saturday night. Dee and monkey suggested the Indian we passed on the way, but Bowie …

Continue reading “DAY SIX”

node.title: DAY FIVE
node.excerpt:
SKA, SPITFIRES AND TEACUPS The trio walked down hill last night to a Thai restaurant for sustenance, on the way they past a working man’s club and heard the sounds of a band warming up. After dinner we trudged back up the mountain Bowie had taken us down arriving at the club which now looked …

Continue reading “DAY FIVE”

node.title: DAY FOUR
node.excerpt:
MEMORY LOSS, BYWAYS, GAMES AND WACKY RACES Last night saw the team bedded in the Lord Kitchener in Lowestoft, a splendid military veterans themed pub run by a friend of Bob Monkeys brother. The hospitality and donations from the venue were superb. We were taken out by Bob and his extended family to a beachfront …

Continue reading “DAY FOUR”

node.title: DAY THREE
node.excerpt:
FEDS, TRACTORS, ARTILLERY PIECES AND ANTS. The team were excellently fed and watered by the staff and customers of The Carpenters in Boston. Also both the landlady and many customers sponsored our mission for which were deeply grateful. During the evening Dee and Bowie enjoyed several orange gins Avec raised pinky’s, not to be outdone …

Continue reading “DAY THREE”

node.title: DAY TWO
node.excerpt:
LIGHTHOUSES, LADYBOY GIN, FLOWERS AND HAREY MOMENTS. Last night the team dined on Indian fare which most delicious, retiring early to the hotel after a hard day on the cubs. However the hotel bar beacons for a nightcap, here sexuality reared it’s ugly head, manly Monkey requested a Westerns Still Cider. Alas his ladyboy associates …

Continue reading “DAY TWO”

node.title: DAMP CASTLES, MOIST BRIDGES, HAIRDRESSING, TWITCHERS & STANDING OVATIONS.
node.excerpt:
This morning was rather moist, but our spirits were not dampened as we set off in earnest on leg two from Dickie & Trudy’s bungalow on Holy Island. Both Monkey and Dee were it must be said in a profound  state of shock having told Bowie we were leaving at seven he was ready to go …

Continue reading “DAMP CASTLES, MOIST BRIDGES, HAIRDRESSING, TWITCHERS & STANDING OVATIONS. “

node.title: THE JOURNEY TO THE START
node.excerpt:
The winter months have seen Daisy, Buttercup and Pansy fully pampered with all three machines serviced, MOT’d and most importantly furnished with new rear suspension units also upgraded 14 tooth front sprockets. The latter item has increased the down hill top speed to a heady 40mph. At 1315 all met at Blood Bikes Cumbria’s Port …

Continue reading “THE JOURNEY TO THE START”

node.title: LEG TWO
node.excerpt:
So the wee Cubs are prepared leg 2 begins on Monday  Carlisle – Holy Island Holy Island – Scarbourgh Scarbourgh – Boston Boston – Lowestoft Lowestoft- Maidstone Maidstone – Ramsgate via Battle of Britain air show at Headcorn Ramsgate – Portsmouth and Isle of Wight  Isle of Wight to Exeter  Home in a van !!!  …

node.title: Day 10 – Journeys end – for now.
node.excerpt:
0730 the team arise after a very relaxing night as gusts of our long-standing friends Dickie and Rachel at their Holy Island bungalow. 0845 – a pre-start check on the girls reviews they are all in need of oil after yesterday’s struggle over bridges and around Scotland’s capital, collectively they consume 400ml of lubricant. 0925 …

Continue reading “Day 10 – Journeys end – for now.”

node.title: Day 9 – Absent bridges and child bullying
node.excerpt:
0800 slowly the team begins to arise and assemble ready for departure at 0930 and the pre-booked escorted crossing of the Tay bridge. The group was added to by our long-standing touring buddy Alastair Brain aka Crystal on his Ducati Multistrada 1260 S. Crystal stopped overnight with us and is today armed with two GoPro’s …
